Description: Male face in relief: the face, which is probably male, is in opaque red glass with glossy surface and has the characteristic flesh folds and pierced ear-lobe of the later Eighteenth Dynasty. It faces right.
Curator's comments: If this relief is indeed of the Amarna Period (and its epicene character tends to confirm this), it is one of the earliest known in red glass. A similar but considerably smaller one in the same medium was found in the Coronation Hall of the palace at el-Amarna and is now in Cairo (66106).
Bibliographic references: Tait 1991 / Five Thousand Years of Glass (fig.37, pp.36-37)
